thread.section_title: Latest business and finance news from New Zealand and the world's key markets - Yahoo New Zealand Finance
thread.title: Stocks to watch on Thursday

title: Stocks to watch on Thursday
text:
Thu, Jul 2, 2015, 10:25 AM NZST - New Zealand Markets close in 6 hrs 35 mins Stocks to watch on Thursday AAP – 17 minutes ago 
Stocks to watch on the Australian stock exchange on Thursday, July 2: 
AIO - ASCIANO - up $1.12, or 16.84 per cent, at $7.77 
Ports and rail operator Asciano is in talks about a $8.8 billion takeover offer from a Canadian-based infrastructure group. 
DLS - DRILLSEARCH - up 1.5 cents, or 1.45 per cent, at $1.05 
Drillsearch shares are higher after the company flagged strong margins despite a slide in production. 
KMD - KATHMANDU - down four cents, or 2.55 per cent, at $1.53 
Kiwi retailer Briscoe has offered a cash and share takeover bid for Kathmandu. 
MUA - MITULA - up five cents, or 6.67 per cent, at 80 cents 
"Vertical search" website operator Mitula has started trading well, jumping within minutes. 
ORG - ORIGIN - down five cents, or 0.42 per cent, at $11.92 
The Clean Energy Finance Corporation has agreed to help energy company Origin drive an increase in the use of solar. 
TGR - TASSAL GROUP - up 27 cents, or 8.11 per cent, at $3.60 
Salmon farmer Tassal has finalised a deal to buy NSW seafood business De Costi. 
WPL - WOODSIDE PETROLEUM - up 43 cents, or 1.26 per cent, at $34.66 
Woodside Petroleum says it's on track to make a final decision on its key Browse gas project at the end of 2016 as it pushes ahead with engineering and design work. @YahooNZBusiness on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Finance News Update, what you need to know AAP 
The Australian dollar is lower after a rise in the greenback following news that Greece had requested a new bailout …
